SENT.plain: We report a case of Anderson-Fabry disease in a young man presenting with cardiac hypertrophy and asymptomatic non-sustained ventricular tachycardia
The patient was referred for evaluation of implantable cardioverter/defibrillator therapy
Assessment of left ventricular ejection fraction is considered the gold standard for identifying patients at risk of sudden cardiac death
However, this patient's left ventricular function was preserved
Electrophysiological study did not reveal inducible arrhythmia or cardiac conduction abnormalities
Review of the literature indicates limited knowledge on the electrophysiology of Fabry cardiomyopathy and highlights the need for optimized risk stratification strategies
